result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Radzinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
*If probation revoked, huber priveleges for employment and any counseling he may be involved in 
*All 6 months to be served in jail

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge 
*Any bond monies posted can be applied to the costs/surcharges
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Complete AODA treatment with Ms Hintzman who has completed her assessment 
*Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Mackenzie Peterson

timeConds.notes:
*Huber priveleges for employment and any counseling he may be involved in
*All 30 days to be served in jail
*Commence sentence within 40 days of today's date (10/18/16)
*Report to jail today for start date

Count 2 - DRI

20 days to appeal

Defendant Joseph D Radzinski in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:34 a.m.   Court calls case and states the appearances.
Continuance of Motion to Revoke Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
Atty Cousins makes statements and can make an offer of proof regarding the issues and states these on the record.
Atty Cousins provides information from Mr. Rick Allen (who does not appear in Court today) and states these on the record.
Court questions the defendant.  
Defendant responds to the Court.
Defendant show's a letter from Ms. Hintzman to Atty Cousins and then it is provided to the Court for review (letter not provided to Mr Allen).
Court questions the defendant as to why he waited an entire year to complete his recommendations of the DPA; defendant responds.
State has complied with victim notification; victim in Court.  
Court reviewed file.  
Court questions Atty Cousisn in regards to a review that had been requested in June 2016; Atty Cousins responds.
Court makes statement to the parties.
9:50 a.m.   Victim makes a statement to the Court.
Atty Cousins makes his recommendations on the record.
Atty Cousins provides the Court with a police report from another person defendant had been in a relationship with.

BY THE COURT:
Court GRANTS State's Motion to Revoke Deferred Prosecution Agreement and would enter Judgment of Conviction today's date.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2016 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph D Radzinski
Current: 6888 Hwy B, Stevens Point, WI 54482 United States  (Effective: 09-27-2016)
Prior: 7385 Cty Tk Ee, Bancroft, WI 54492

10:46 a.m.  Court calls the case.  
Defendant appears.  Atty Cass Cousins appears in Court for the State of Wisconsin. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed. 

Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court.  Notice was originally set for 9 a.m.  The court moved it to the 8:20 time due to other matters. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant does not dispute.  
Atty Cousins provides an update to the Court.  The agent left voicemails and emails with the defendant, failed to respond.
Defendant indicates his phone number has changed.  Since getting the revocation letter, he has tried to contact Mr. Allen by calling and going to JusticeWorks but to no avail.

BY THE COURT:  Court will continue the matter for 20 minutes to hear testimony and make a decision. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Defendant is working at Papa Murphy's and Amore which will be closing on Friday.

Court advises the defendant to inform the Clerk of Courts office of any change of address.

Defendant Joseph D Radzinski not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:23 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court reviews the file.  Notice of hearing was returned as undeliverable.  
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court.  Asks the court to grant the motion and order a bench warrant for the defendant's failure to appear. 

BY THE COURT:  Court orders a bench warrant, $1,000 cash alternative.

Atty Cousins questions the Court. 
Court advises the motion will be handled at the time of a bail hearing.   Sign an affidavit so Mr. Allen would not have to be here at the bail hearing.
Motion Hearing set for 09/27/16 - not deliverable as addressed
Motion hearing on September 27, 2016 at 08:20 am.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Prosecution Agreemet filed by the State
Motion Hearing set for September 27, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.
Review Hearing set for 06/10/16 - no such number

Defendant Joseph D Radzinski in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:39 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins provide update on the defendant progress on DP. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
Review hearing on June 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement /s/ TTF 10/23/15

Defendant Joseph D Radzinski in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:30 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court questions Atty Cousins re: victim notification.   Has consulted with the victim and did not expect her to appear. 
Court proceeds with the understanding that the defendant stay until 9:45 in case the victim does appear. 

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Court questions the defendant on Waiver of Counsel. 
Defendant wishes to proceed without an attorney. 
BY THE COURT:  Court finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to counsel. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD Judgment of Conviction due to a DPA being entered into. 
Court approves the DPA and signs with today's date.  

DPA paperwork is give to Atty Cousins for copying and distribution. 

12:05 p.m.  Court recalls the case. 
Atty Cousins is present. 
Defendant and counsel are not present. 

Atty Cousins indicates Count 2 should be dismissed and read-in. 
BY THE COURT:  So ordered.
Plea hearing at 10-23-2015 09:45 am
